stimulusHtml: Great Zimbabwe is most similar to which of the following architectural works?

features.html: © Werner Forman Archive/The Bridgeman Art Library

choicesHtml: The Great Mosque at Djenné, because of its conical forms and building materials
Mesa Verde cliff dwellings, because of its stone masonry and semi-sunken structures
Machu Picchu, because of its undulating stone masonry constructed without mortar
Chartres Cathedral, because of the use of an external buttressing technique
